Name: Good Old Hook Nose: Wargame Rules for the Napoleonic Wars
Description:
'Good Old Hook Nose is a set of rules for the Napoleonic period, allowing players to recreate Napoleonic battles in a way that emphasises the role played by the Gentlemen and Officers of the period. Players will need to seize control of every situation, in order to win the day with dash and swagger. The name comes from the affectionate nickname given to Wellington by his troops.

The rules use a no-dice mechanism, aiming to bring the fun and suspense back into wargaming. They are designed to allow large games with lots of commands and are suitable for multi-player games for an evening, or longer.

Good Old Hook Nose aims to give a feel for the period and the way command and control worked in the century, where uniform, discipline and control were as much a part of battle as good training and armaments. They make no claim to be overly historically accurate.

—description from the publisher's webpage

Name: I'm No Spartacus: Simple Gladiator Wargaming Rules
Description:
I’m No Spartacus is a set of simple wargames rules for teams of three gladiators to fight to the death in the Arena in Ancient Rome’s games. Players control a small group of gladiators with the intent of gaining the Emperor’s favour.

The rules are played with cards and dice, using a simple mechanism to allow a free flowing and fast game, taking seconds to learn and years to master. A typical game will last around an hour, allowing for several games to be played on a normal club evening.

Up to four teams can enter the arena but only one will be the winner.

—description from the publisher's webpage

Name: An Uncivil Affair: Wargame Rules for the English Civil Wars
Description:
An Uncivil Affair is a set of rules for the English Civil wars period, allowing players to recreate the ebb and flow of the battles in a way that emphasises the role played by the Gentlemen and Colonels of the period.

Players will need to seize control of every situation, in order to win the day with dash and swagger, recreating the lines of pike and shot, as well as the sweeping cavalry popular in this period, with little or no control of the outcome.

The rules use a no-dice mechanism, aiming to bring the fun and suspense back into wargaming. They are designed to allow large games with lots of commands and are suitable for multi-player games for an evening, or longer.

An Uncivil Affair aims to give a feel for the period and the way command and control worked in the century, where looks and religious piety were as much a part of battle as good training and armaments. They make no claim to be overly historically accurate.

—description from the publisher's webpage

Name: タビネズミ開拓記 (Lemmings' Frontier)
Description:
ã‚¿ãƒ“ãƒã‚ºãƒŸé–‹æ‹“è¨˜ (Lemmings' Frontier) is a co-operative game from Japan, with lemmings exploring and taming a new wild land. The game is played with two phases each round: an Investigation phase of exploring and tackling monsters, and a Base phase of using the resources gathered from exploring to improve the camp and make new tools.

The game has skill cards and item cards, and two boards. The smaller board is the Base camp and a pathway leads on and through the larger board. Here, the path branches, letting the lemmings find different routes through to the final goal. Each location contains a hidden creature and the end goals also vary. Players only win if they complete the adventure and satisfy the final goal's demands.

Players defeat the monsters by combining tools and skills to beat a strength target on the monster's card.
user summary

Name: Flames in the South: Wargames Rules for the American Civil War
Description:
Flames in the South is a set of rules for the American Civil War, allowing players to recreate the open warfare and firepower of the ACW in a way that emphasises the role played by the Gentlemen and Officers of the period. Players will need to seize control of every situation, in order to win the day with sweat and tears, as brother fights brother.

The rules use a no-dice mechanism, aiming to bring the fun and suspense back into wargaming. They are designed to allow large games with lots of commands and are suitable for multi-player games for an evening, or longer.

Flames in the South aims to give a feel for the period and the way command and control worked in the war, where loyalty to your state and family were as much a part of battle as good training and armaments. They make no claim to be overly historically accurate.

—description from the publisher's webpage

Name: Trip 1907 (2nd Edition): Dark Sails
Description:
Trip 1907 Interactive Escape the Book Game was released in 2018. It has been translated by Kosmos Verlag in German, Polish, Frech, Italian, Czech and Hungarian under the title of EXIT das buch series of Kosmos EXIT GAMES.

This second version will include a new gameplay system, new faster website,  and 5+ new puzzles and riddles.
Families: Admin: Outside the Scope of BGG

Name: Lajka
Description:
Lajka, the astronaut dog goes on an expedition. It meets interesting space creatures, explores the Planet of Doggy’s Treasures, then arrives to the Planet of the Space Worms, where it can meet colourful worms.

Help Lajka, roll the dice and colour the space creatures, dog’s toys and the space worms!

The game Lajka is indeed three different, stand-alone game for diferrent age-groups. Players in their turn roll four (coloured) dice, and than use the result, to colour their sheets. In "Space Critters", (for the youngest ones, above 3 years) you try to find all the matching colours on your critter-sheet. The one, who's finish it first wins the game.
In "Doggy's Treasures" (for the middle ones, above 5 years)you should use your thrown coloures to make the shapes (drawn at the bottom of the doggy's sheet). The shapes worth different stars, the goal is to reach 12 stars. The one with the most stars wins the game!
In "Space Worms" (for the older ones, above 8 years), you have to make unicoloured worms, leading from one designated point to another one. You earn point after the area, your worms enclose, for stars you've collected (wich can also be used during the game to have certain actions), your longest unfinished worm, and the coloures you used. When someone finishes his/her second worm, the game ends, and the player with the most points win.

Name: Éjszaka az Állatkertben
Description: You rub your eyes and look around. It's cold and dark. Where are you? You quickly realize that you have appeared in the zoo at night! Walking in the crisp snow, you recognize the entrance with its polar bears, the lake and the big rock, but the animals are nowhere to be seen. Instead, you meet a variety of different creatures. One of them turns to you to ask for your help. You must carry out a mission for which you are given a map showing a part of the zoo in detail. Based on this, and going via certain points in the zoo, you need to reach the final stage of your mission. The task seems easy, but the strange creatures that pop up and the blizzard howling around you make it difficult to navigate. Fortunately, if you listen carefully and manage to memorise all the stops on your journey, you can succeed in your mission. Meanwhile, the others are also wandering around the zoo. Which of you will achieve your goal first?

Name: Operation PBSUCCESS: The 1954 Guatemalan Coup
Description:
Operation PBSUCCESS is a fast-playing solitaire game that simulates the 1954 coup of Guatemala. The player takes the role of the CIA-backed and Castillo Armas-led rebels, fighting against the Árbenz presidency. But it also models the wider Cold War political and economic issues faced by President Eisenhower’s team, his CIA leadership, the surrounding Central American countries, and even the United Nations.

This card-driven game takes place through the weeks and months of early to mid-1954.

The object of the player is to use political, covert, and paramilitary operations to effect regime change by isolating Árbenz and preparing rebel forces to take the capital of Guatemala City. The game system will play the role of the Árbenz government as it tries to hold on to power.

—description from the designer

Name: MechAge: The Stand
Description:
The enemy base is yours and repairs are underway to restore it to operations as your new HQ. However, it would seem that the creators of the Nova radiation are anxious to remove the evidence of their activities. Recon reports huge waves of enemy mutants headed straight forward for you and their intent is clear, wipe out the base at any cost. Stand your ground and bring the defenses online, things are going to get rough...

Adventure scenario expansion for MechAge.


The scenario consists in 1 Scenario card and 2 Mech cards:

     Rules booklet
     The Stand Scenario card
     Light Rail Gun Mech card
     Shield Mech card


Players are expected to provide their own tokens for this scenario:

     8 Tracking tokens



Released in the August 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

Name: Helionox: Catastrophic Events Pack
Description:
10 cards to use in your copy of Helionox to make it more difficult. These were a Kickstarter promo Item referenced in the rules.

Contents:
2 Transhuman Colony Revolt (Martian)
2 The Last War (Old World)
2 Thanatos 273 (Ceres)
2 The Siege on Imbrium Citadel (Lunar)
2 Collapse of the Chitrani Rift (Europan)

Name: La détanque mini
Description:
La détanque is a game of pétanque, dice and square balls at the same time!

It's the same principle as pétanque, you throw the cochodé (the jack dice) and then each team tries to position their dice as close as possible to the cochodé.

Where détanque brings an additional playful aspect is that one side of each of the dice represents a super power. Swap the place of a dice, multiply the points by two or divide them ... We are not at the end of our surprises!

Added to this are the different sides of the cochodé which can make you play a whole game on one foot, throwing with 2 hands or throwing with your left hand if you are right-handed and vice versa ... A lot of fun!

The first team to reach 30 points win

La détanque mini weighs about 700 g with 43mm diameter dice and easier to carry around or play inside.
La détanque weighs about 3.5 kg with 75mm diameter dice and let you play outside

Name: Genetix
Description:
Strategy card-laying game where players send their small blob army through a high-tech genetics lab, gathering mutations and slowly evolving into higher forms of life. Mutants race through the lab and battle opponents on the way to the Cloning Center!

In Genetix, players take turns laying unique multipurpose 'tile cards' to create a growing labyrinth of electric fences, energy barriers, acid pools and steel walls. In doing so, they also activate mutation abilities with which the creatures can exploit in battle.

Special helixes evolve the blobs into higher life-forms with very different mods of behavior.

As the mutants race through the lab and do battle, the first to reach the Cloning Center wins the round and his/her species gets to increases its ranks!

Genetix is played in multiple rounds (three suggested). After the final round, the player controlling the greatest number of mutants wins!

-description from designer

Name: Victory at Sea: Akagi
Description:
Originally laid down as an Amagi-class battlecruiser, the stipulations of the Washington Treaty resulted in her conversion to an aircraft carrier. As a result, Akagi (èµ¤åŸŽ, "Red Castle") was one of Japan’s first large aircraft carriers. Akagi and her near-sister Kaga straddled the line between carrier and dreadnought. To keep both options open, the ships were designed to be quickly converted to capital ships. They carried turret barbettes, magazines and other equipment to support big gun turrets, and the wooden flight deck and hangar deck were designed to be quickly stripped off, making room for turrets to be mounted. However, by the mid-1930s, the admirals believed the aircraft carrier to be the equal of the capital ship and Akagi was extensively rebuilt to improve aircraft handling capacity, ending any possibility of later converting it to a capital ship.

Her aircraft served in the Second Sino-Japanese War in the late 1930s. With the formation of the First Air Fleet in 1941, she became its flagship, and remained so until her sinking. Notable actions include the attack on Pearl Harbor, the invasion of Rabaul, bombing Darwin, Australia and the Indian Ocean Raid.

In June 1942, she participated in the Battle of Midway, her aircraft bombarding the American-held atoll. However, US aircraft originating from Midway, and the US carriers Enterprise, Hornet and Yorktown attacked Akagi and three other Japanese fleet carriers. Dive bombers from USS Enterprise severely damaged Akagi, forcing friendly escorting destroyers to scuttle her to avoid her falling into US hands. The loss of four Japanese carriers at this engagement, including Akagi, was a key defeat for Japan, decisively shifting the balance of power in the Pacific theatre.

—description from the publisher

Name: Encore: Adrenaline Battle
Description:
Encore can be played 1v.1, 4v.4, 2v.7 or even solo. Will you be the cool and determined team blaze or energetic and speedy team lightning? Draw from the center action card pile and your own time card pile to begin the game. As you do your workout hand, the other team rests, but watch out! If you are caught resting after the other team has finished their round, you get to go overtime.

Every game you play is a different workout, sit-ups for 60 seconds and then burpees for 90 anyone? Probably not, but in that case you can always take your chances by drawing a wild card. By adding or taking out different amounts of time cards and workout cards, you can customize your difficulty level. You can also decide to start adding victory cards before or after the 8 minute mark to change the level of challenge. Various game modes from True Victor to Team Relay are also included in the instruction manual.

Once a team’s total time cards add up to 8 minutes, a victory card is shuffled into the time card pile. Now they have the chance to win!  For every consecutive minute, another victory card is added to the time card pile until one team draws a victory card. This team is the winner!

Name: Victory at Sea: USS Yorktown
Description:
The Yorktown-class of aircraft carrier were built in a series of three. Of those, only the USS Enterprise survived the war, with the USS Yorktown sunk during the Battle of Midway, and the USS Hornet during the Battle of Santa Cruz.

USS Yorktown was commissioned in 1937, and named for the battle of 1781. After Pearl Harbor, USS Yorktown transferred to the Pacific and took part in some of the first American offences of the war around the Gilbert and Marshall Islands. She also fought at the Battle of the Coral Sea where her aircraft (along with the carrier Lexington's) sank enemy light carrier ShÅhÅ prior to engaging the main Japanese carrier force the following day (May 8th 1942). During this latter stage of the engagement, the US carriers' aircraft inflicted damage to the IJN carrier ShÅkaku, but in turn USS Yorktown suffered heavy damage. Lexington suffered worse, and was later scuttled as a result.

Returning to Hawaii, repairs were estimated to take two weeks, but she was put back to sea a mere 48 hours after entering drydock, in time to play a crucial part in the decisive Battle of Midway. Her aircraft were instrumental in the sinking of two Japanese fleet carriers. Her presence also drew the attention of Japanese aerial attacks away from USS Entreprise and Hornet. Though crippled by Japanese aircraft, there was optimism that she could be salvaged in part. These hopes were dashed on June 6th when torpedoes from the Japanese submarine I-168 struck her twice. Further hopes of repair were abandoned, and she sank the following day.

—description from the publisher

Name: Worldwide Football: Ligue des Étoiles
Description:
Worldwide Football: Ligue des Étoiles

Take the helm of a major European football club (Barcelona, Paris, Turin…) and set off to conquer the most prestigious of European leagues!

This expansion requires the Worldwide Football base game plus Expansions 1 and'2. 
It also includes Worldwide Football First Edition Update Kit.

Name: Fato Fake
Description:
Fato Fake is a knowledge contest. Do you think you know enough? So prepare your memory and let's get started.

Start of the game: Each player chooses a color among the available pins and the oldest player shuffles the cards and places them stacked in the indicated place on the board, with the back side facing up.

With all the pins in the “start” box. 
The first must advance one space on the board, remove the first card from the pile and, without looking, hand it over to the player on your right. Then, you must turn the roulette wheel. If the pointer stops at of the colored boxes, the player with the card reads the question with the corresponding color on the card and, at the end of the statement read, asks: “Fact or fake? ”.

If the player gets it right, he gets the card. If he misses, the card goes to a lot of discard.

Attention: If the pointer stops over the “CHALLENGE” box, the player must point any player, according to his strategy, to respond.
If the chosen player gets it right, he keeps the card; if he misses, the player who challenged him stays with her.
But wait! Do you think it's easy? If the roulette stops on the “AZAR” box, the player must answer 2 questions to keep the card. For example: If he hits the first and misses the second, he will be forced to hit the third to keep the card. If you miss 2 questions, the letter goes to lot of disposal.

The next one on the left removes a card from the pile on the board, advances one square and repeats the process.

The game ends when the first player reaches the final square. At that point, all players count their cards. Win that one that got it right and, consequently, has more cards.

Name: アルバ・シビタスのあるきかた (Alba Civitas no Arukikata)
Description:
ã‚¢ãƒ«ãƒãƒ»ã‚·ãƒ“ã‚¿ã‚¹ã®ã‚ã‚‹ãã‹ãŸ (Aruba Shibitasu no Arukikata) (How to walk Alba Civitas) is a game from Japan. Players are travelling around the city of Aruba at night, seeking hidden treasures. They meet local residents, find tools and clues that help them unearth the treasures.

A mixture of memo and actions, the city is a layout of face-down cards. On their turn, a player may move around and flip two cards, and memorise them. The cards have various conditions, and if a player satisfies the conditions, they get to keep the card or cards. These then help them further in their quest. By memorising the locations as all players reveal them, players race to complete the tasks and catch the most treasure to win.
user summary

Name: Mountain, River, River, Sun
Description: An extremely simple game, with extremely simple rules, that will nonetheless test your powers of observation, planning, and focus. Try to match the sequence on the goal card with the larger symbols on your cards, while simultaneously preventing your opponent from doing it first with theirs. Trickier than it sounds.

Name: Inn Keeper
Description:
Compete as Inn Keepers working to fill your Inn with the most guests by winning tricks and placing cards in sequential order on to your board. Earn extra points by offering amenities customers want. Split points for referring guests when you don’t have what they want and for fulfilling your bonus card goals. The Inn Keeper with the most points at the end is the winner!

-description from designer

Name: The Pursuit of Happiness: Big Box
Description:
The beloved thematic worker placement board game 'The Pursuit of Happiness' now in a big box containing all 3 expansions, Community, Experiences, Nostalgia, and the 4 Kickstarter promos KS1, KS2, KS3 and KS4!

The Pursuit of Happiness: Big Box is a storage option for all The Pursuit of Happiness material released to date. Inside The Pursuit of Happiness: Big Box you can easily fit all material of The Pursuit of Happiness core game, The Pursuit of Happiness: Community expansion, The Pursuit of Happiness: Experiences expansion, The Pursuit of Happiness: Nostalgia expansion and all mini expansions including KS1, KS2, KS3 and KS4 Promo Packs, Thug Life, Out of this World and more. The Big Box also fits all standard or deluxe components of the game.The Pursuit of Happiness: Big Box includes a 2-level plastic custom tray and a consolidated rulebook for all The Pursuit of Happiness material.

—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: NATO, Nukes & Nazis: The Lutwaffe Strikes!
Description:
"NATO, Nukes & Nazis: The Lutwaffe Strikes!", published by XTR inside the issue #10 of his "Command"  wargaming magazine, is an expansion for the alternative-history simulation wargame "NATO, Nukes & Nazis".

In this variant the German economy of the "NNN" world did better during the 1980's than what was first postulated in the original wargame: this resulted in greatly increased production of tactical aircraft types, which in turn will dramatically increase the German offensive potential making it, in some ways, similar to that employed in the 1940 BlitzKrieg against Holland, Belgium and France.

13 new Nazis' counters:
- 9 Tac Air
- 4 Helicopters
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Snollebollekes: Het kaartspel
Description:
The crazy card game to give every party an extra boost! To the left?! Or to the right ?! You can go in any direction in this card game! Roll the die and strategically discard your cards to earn as many ties as possible. Or don't those ties excite you and would you rather see your friends doing crazy dances, riding on each other's backs and walking the polonaise? Create your own game by adding the party cards and take on crazy physical challenges. Or do you really want to remove all limits and do you want to "drink, lick and dance"? Then add the 18+ cards! Snollebollekes - The card game is for all people who love a damn good party!

—description from the publisher

Name: Woord Bluf
Description:
The creative word game.
Challenge your friends and family in this tactical word game. Grab a pen and create the longest words to earn the most points. All players have the same letters at their disposal, so play smart and beat your opponents. If you can’t form a word, you can choose to bluff. But when caught bluffing, you will receive penalty points. Be creative with the letters or bluff your way through the rounds and crown yourself as the ‘Word King’ with Word Bluff!

—description from the publisher

Name: Tower Of Pancakes!!
Description:
Tower Of Pancakes!! (ã‚¿ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ãƒ»ã‚ªãƒ–ãƒ»ãƒ‘ãƒ³ã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¯ã‚¹â€¼) is a trick-taking card game from Japan.

Cute cats love pancakes! Bake pancakes well, serve them, and aim to become the best-selling pancake maker!

There are 4 cats (A to D) waiting to be served pancakes. If they get more than 8 pancakes in a stack, the surplus becomes negative points. Except cat D, who is a glutton, and just makes more stacks of pancakes.

The players have chips of batter which are turned into cooked pancakes. The game follows standard trick-taking rules. The 1st & 2nd winners of the trick supply pancakes to the cats. The loser of the trick cooks their batter into pancakes according to the card they played.

When the tricks are played out, a final score is calculated based upon where players placed their cooked pancakes, minus penalties for over-supply.

The game has two variants in the rules; one for a different style of hand management, and one for an extreme supply of pancakes.
user summary

Name: Max geheugentrainer
Description:
PLAY THE FAMOUS SHOPPING GAME NOW AS A CARD GAME AND TEST YOUR MEMORY!
Which player remembers best what is on his shopping list? Use your memory and fill your shopping cart with the products you saw on your list at the start of the game. But beware: the other players put things in your cart that you don't need at all! Who knows to remember their shopping list until the end and comes home with the right products?

—description from the publisher

Name: Dice Hospital: Specialist Promo Bundle
Description:
4 Specialist cards for Dice Hospital, Previously available via the 2018-Kickstarter campaign and now for sale on the website of Alley Cat Games.

It contains:

2 x Consultant (cards feature different character art) At the beginning of each Hospital Activation Phase, chose another Specialist in your hospital. The Consultant has the same special ability as the chose Specialist until the end of the phase.
2 x Admissions Nurse (cards feature different character art): Each time this Specialist discharges a patient, you may either return an other patient to the bag, or draw a new patient from the bag to roll and add to your wards (re-roll 1's and 6's as normal).

Name: O Petiz Que Mordeu O Cão
Description:
This expansion was designed for children. In O Petiz Que Mordeu O Cão, children play it by telling funny stories.
This expansion can be played by adding new cards (with new words) to the base game. It is a family game, which people asks questions like "Where?", "Who?", "What?", "To Who?", "With What?".

Name: Atelier daVinci
Description:
This game has been published by dV Giochi as a reward for winning the 2019/2020 edition of the Gioco Inedito – Best Unpublished game contest. Powered by Lucca comics & Games and dV Giochi, the contest aims to identify the best new card game design from all prototypes received and to reward it by publishing the game in a fully professional and high-quality format, overseen directly by dV Giochi. All prototypes submitted must conform to the technical and style requirements, fixed components and a given theme which changes every year. Everybody can join the contest and this is a great opportunity for emerging game designers to see their idea published.

In Maestro Leonardo's workshop, there are many apprentices who try to earn the master’s esteem. You too can participate in the creation of the greatest works of this genius of the Renaissance, painting or completing paintings shared with the group, becoming an expert in colors, and attracting the attention of the master with your achievements. Who will eventually become his pupil?

1. Take color cards from the table.
2. Use them to paint paintings and score points.
3. Score bonus points with Masteries and Achievement cards!

—description from the publisher

Name: 愛のてんびん (Aino tenbin)
Description:
æ„›ã®ã¦ã‚“ã³ã‚“ (Aino tenbin) (Love balance) is a party game from Japan.

The deck has a variety of confessions of love, such as gifts, flowers, chocolates, a ring and so on. Players try to shed their hand down to zero first, by playing a card to match another player's.

The lead player offers a card, such as a ring, to another player. If they have the same card in hand, they discard it too. If they do not have the matching card, they say they acknowledge the feelings but cannot reciprocate, so they accept the gift card into their hand. The giver is now heart-broken and draws another card from the deck as solace.

Players can block a romance by playing other cards from their hand, such as "I'm sorry", or "wait a minute!" to steal a gift, or "I'm watching you" to block a confessor.

The first player to empty their hand wins.
user summary

Name: Munchkin Enhancers
Description:
Flavor up your Munchkin games with Munchkin Enhancers, which includes thirty new monster, Treasure, Class, and Race enhancers for use with Munchkin, Munchkins & Mazes, Munchkin Tails, Munchkin Oz, or any set that uses the original Munchkin card backs.

—description from the publisher

Name: We're In
Description:
The firewall is down, but they know you got in. Now, it's a race to grab the most valuable information as the network shuts down around you. But be wary of the other hackers, as it's just as easy to steal from each other as from the system.

We’re In is a small route-planning game for 2 to 4 players. Each player controls an avatar moving around an ever-shrinking grid of tiles representing a nodes on company’s network, such as email servers or security cameras. When you move onto a tile, you hack the node to extract a token of information secretly worth 1, 2 or 3 points. Once all of the company’s secrets have been looted, you steal from each other instead.

With each move, tiles are tagged for suspicious activity and eventually shutdown, leaving gaps in the network and limiting your movement. When you move onto an occupied node, you are forced to share information with those players, surrendering your hard-won tokens. Your spoils are only secure after you logout of the system, either by running out of possible moves or waiting until the network gets small enough to slip out. Once everyone has logged out, the winner is the player with the most valuable set of tokens.

—description from the designer

Name: DirtSlingers
Description:
DirtSlingers is a dirt-track, Sprint Car themed racing game for 2 to 8 players. Using 3 different card decks to move pawns around the oval track, many movements will not only move your pawns but other player's pawns as well.

Complete with 4 different modes of play, DirtSlingers has something for any racing fan. Play as 305 or 410 Sprint Cars and use either Rookie or Veteran gameplay. A small change in the decks of cards can make all the difference.

Like any other racing game, the goal is to get across the finish first, but the game doesn't stop there. Not only are there four different races to finish, but play multiple times and record your progresses to compete in a Season game.

—description from the designer

Name: Deadletterz
Description:
Spell like you and your friend's lives depended on it! Action verbs can hurt or escape the zombie, can help your friends... or not! Pick up a shotgun and spell "shoot" to blow the zombie's head off! Strengthen your spelling skills while exercising strategic thinking in this cooperative and competitive game of survival. Can you make it out alive?

—description from the publisher

Name: Death Ride Normandy: Sword Beach
Description:
This game focuses on the British landing at Sword Beach by the British 3rd Infantry Division.

The British 3rd Infantry Division, along with Royal Marine and Commando's, assault the continent at Sword Beach.  One of the most important beaches in the entire operation due to its location nearest to the city of Caen.  The city was an important objective to capture in the first day of the invasion.  Some parts of the plan went perfect, such as the 1st Special Services Brigade getting to the Pegasus Bridge area to relieve the paratroopers at about 1200 hours.  The picture on this box cover is of the Bagpiper that accompanied Lord Lovat, commander of 1st SS Brigade.

Death Ride Normandy - Sword Beach:
    Sword Beach and Caen Maps
    20+ Counter Sheets
   5x Scenarios Based on each day, and a smaller Scenario each for 7-10 June
    3ID Order of Battle
    I Corps Order of Battle
    21PzD Order of Battle
    Sword WNs
    Transport Charts
    Wave Charts
    Supplemental Rules

Name: Dog's Breath
Description:
This card game is perfect for ye olde tavern complete with good ale and a warm fire. Quench your thirst for trick-taking in this fast-paced game of huffing and hoarding. Eat the worst food and choose which end from which to expel your rotten doggy hotness! Silly and fast-paced, strategize what to collect and what to discard and when, and how to arrange/hide your hand.

—description from the publisher

Name: Death Ride Normandy: Operation Tonga
Description:
This game is based on the parachute and glider landings by the British 6th Airborne Division east of the Orne River.

The British 6th Airborne Division has the mission of parachuting into the area east of the Orne River in order to hold the eastern flank of the entire invasion.

Death Ride Normandy - Operation Tonga:
    Merville, Houlgate, Troarn, and Mezidon Maps
    10+ Counter Sheets
    5x Scenarios Based on each day, and a smaller Scenario each for 7-10 June
    6ABD Order of Battle
    51ID Order of Battle
    711ID Order of Battle
    346ID Order of Battle
    Merville WNs
    Drop and Landing Charts
    Supplemental Rules

Name: Dogonauts: Starflea Territories
Description:
The stop-motion short film Dogonauts: Enemy Line introduces the Dogonauts universe. The card game Dogonauts: Starflea Territories continues from the film and pits players against one another to see who can repair their space ship first. Area control is the name of this game! Two versions of Dober the space dog and Fester the space flea can be chosen to deploy your battlefield tactics.

—description from the publisher

Name: EcoGoGo!: Grand Canyon Nat'l Park
Description:
EcoGoGo! is an educational and entertaining card game designed to inform and inspire interest in our world’s ecology. It highlights the roles of food chains, feeding, mating, and migration in the lives of organisms in a wide variety of ecosystems.

The Grand Canyon National Park deck is built on extensively researched food chains comprising real organisms found in their native habitats. Includes the Great Horned Owl, Common Kingsnake, Grand Canyon Rattlesnake, Golden-mantled Ground Squirrel, Common Earless Lizard, Darkling Beetle, and Poop. The environmental threat is Toxic Waste.

—description from the publisher

Name: CBI ATC:  China-Burma-India Air Transport Command
Description:
This is a VERY playable (free to print off and play) aerial transportation solitaire game about the U.S. Army Air Force's effort to fly supplies to China to keep it in World War 2 and tie up so many Imperial Japanese Army soldiers on the Asian mainland which it did.  http://www.CoatneyHistory.com/CBIATC.htm

(In the "Advanced" game, one player can be the Equipment transporter and the other the Fuel Transporter and separate record/chits could be kept to see if they achieve their respective delivery requirements.  Of course, if either fails too often, they both lose overall, so .... :-) )

The player chooses either the H (High Himalayas) route with its hazards or the M (Japanese fighter-interceptor aerodrome at Myitkina) route.  He takes the maximum number of transport aircraft pieces possible and then adds to that upside-down piece mix a number of hazard pieces equal to half the number of transports rounded up.

(In 1942-43, trying to fly the lower route over Myitkina is very much pushing your luck, depending on Japanese fighter strength and who wins the air battle.)

From that inverted total he pulls a number of pieces equal to the number of original transports and finds out if sufficient loads - DC3s/C-47s carry 1, C-46s and (B-24 Liberator transport) C-87s carry 2 (although the C-87s can only carry 1 over the High route), and the late war DC-4s/C-54s carry *4*! - make it over the Hump.

Of course, the number of loads required each season increases with the Allied supreme commanders' demands.

The USAAF Air Transport Command actually delivered far more supplies in the air than could be delivered by gas-guzzling trucks on the Burma and then Ledo/Stilwell Roads.

Hazards include Engine Failure, Unexpected Mountain, Mule Stampede! (wrecking the center of gravity ... 3,000 mules were delivered, 4 to a plane), Spontaneous Explosion (C-46s only), Bad Compass-Thick Clouds-Out of Gas, Oxygen Loss-Disorientation, and Rock Throwing Yetis! (Some planes just disappeared along the costly "Aluminum Highway." Wrecks and remains are still being found.)

The no-dice Basic Game plays in about 40 minutes max. and really gives you the overall sense of the air transport campaign.  (Ernest K. Gann was an ATC pilot and later wrote the book Fate is the Hunter.  The movie is free to watch on YouTube.)

The Advanced Game, differentiating Fuel and Equipment loads,  including sea and rail transport cargo capacities to the East India airfields, and having abstracted ground combat rules takes longer.

All aircraft icons are by me, pixel by pixel (hence, the small datafile size of the counter sheet).

The Dedication includes mention of one Bob Coatney, who was a master sergeant based at ATC headquarters in Dacca, East India.

—description from the designer

Name: Gem Runner: Starring Bit Boy
Description:
Retro 8-bit video game-like adventure with Bit Boy battling enemies, bosses, and classic video game hazards to earn and steal Gems! The fight for justice to rid the world of evil begins with you and your friends! Join our hero. Conquer the hazards. Defeat the enemies. Obliterate the bosses. Get the Gems!

Take turns presenting each other with classic video game challenges, always putting a Gem as a reward at the end. Play with or against your friends, or even the 'computer!' Learn the depth of the subtle strategies in Gem Runner, and emerge victorious!

Presenting a challenge involves chaining elements together and trying to make the most difficult obstacles to overcome. Playing against a challenge involves matching an element or a game mechanic (e.g. punch, jump, etc.) with what is required for each challenge.

There are 4 heroes, each with their own deck (sold separately) that include all unique hazards, enemies, and bosses. Decks can be played together to expand the number of gems collectable per player, and add some unique gameplay.

—description from the publisher

Name: Gem Runner: Starring Cache Cat
Description:
Retro 8-bit video game-like adventure with Cache Cat battling enemies, bosses, and classic video game hazards to earn and steal Gems! The fight for justice to rid the world of evil begins with you and your friends! Join our hero. Conquer the hazards. Defeat the enemies. Obliterate the bosses. Get the Gems!

Take turns presenting each other with classic video game challenges, always putting a Gem as a reward at the end. Play with or against your friends, or even the 'computer!' Learn the depth of the subtle strategies in Gem Runner, and emerge victorious!

Presenting a challenge involves chaining elements together and trying to make the most difficult obstacles to overcome. Playing against a challenge involves matching an element or a game mechanic (e.g. punch, jump, etc.) with what is required for each challenge.

There are 4 heroes, each with their own deck (sold separately) that include all unique hazards, enemies, and bosses. Decks can be played together to expand the number of gems collectable per player, and add some unique gameplay.

—description from the publisher

Name: Gem Runner: Starring Data Dog
Description:
Retro 8-bit video game-like adventure with Data Dog battling enemies, bosses, and classic video game hazards to earn and steal Gems! The fight for justice to rid the world of evil begins with you and your friends! Join our hero. Conquer the hazards. Defeat the enemies. Obliterate the bosses. Get the Gems!

Take turns presenting each other with classic video game challenges, always putting a Gem as a reward at the end. Play with or against your friends, or even the 'computer!' Learn the depth of the subtle strategies in Gem Runner, and emerge victorious!

Presenting a challenge involves chaining elements together and trying to make the most difficult obstacles to overcome. Playing against a challenge involves matching an element or a game mechanic (e.g. punch, jump, etc.) with what is required for each challenge.

There are 4 heroes, each with their own deck (sold separately) that include all unique hazards, enemies, and bosses. Decks can be played together to expand the number of gems collectable per player, and add some unique gameplay.

—description from the publisher

Name: Gem Runner: Starring Giga Girl
Description:
Retro 8-bit video game-like adventure with Giga Girl battling enemies, bosses, and classic video game hazards to earn and steal Gems! The fight for justice to rid the world of evil begins with you and your friends! Join our hero. Conquer the hazards. Defeat the enemies. Obliterate the bosses. Get the Gems!

Take turns presenting each other with classic video game challenges, always putting a Gem as a reward at the end. Play with or against your friends, or even the 'computer!' Learn the depth of the subtle strategies in Gem Runner, and emerge victorious!

Presenting a challenge involves chaining elements together and trying to make the most difficult obstacles to overcome. Playing against a challenge involves matching an element or a game mechanic (e.g. punch, jump, etc.) with what is required for each challenge.

There are 4 heroes, each with their own deck (sold separately) that include all unique hazards, enemies, and bosses. Decks can be played together to expand the number of gems collectable per player, and add some unique gameplay.

—description from the publisher

Name: Itty Kitty
Description:
Introducing Nooki, the Itty Kitty with a penchant for adorable, feline mischief. Use memory and matching to satisfy Itty-Kitty and your desire for laughter and facepalms. Challenge your memory and a bit of strategy to prevail. No kitties (Itty or otherwise) were harmed in the making of this game.

Each turn consists of uncovering 2 face-down cards and either matching them to each other, or matching 1 or more cards from your hand. Matching connects a kitty card (which depicts Nooki desiring something) with a desire card (which depicts a desire). The player with the most cards in their kitty "bed" wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: My Secret Garden: Game & Puzzle
Description:
Cooperate to create a secret garden together, or compete to earn the most points in this double-sided adventure that includes a game and a puzzle. This experience is designed to be relaxing while you enjoy the simple act of putting puzzle pieces together, or lining up elements of a garden for more points. Play cooperatively or competitively with friends and family as peaceful calm surrounds you.

—description from the publisher

Name: Peas, Pirates, and a Potato Bug
Description:
Based on the adorable children's book of rhyming tales of the same name, our Peas, Pirates, and a Potato Bug card game (nicknamed "P3") allows kids and parents to construct pictures from the book like jigsaw puzzle pieces. This is a quick and easy game for children and families to play together in a fun, relaxed environment.

P3 can be played cooperatively or competitively. Competing requires each player to finish one of the many pictures that can be constructed to collect the picture's cards. The player with the most cards at the end wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Polar Rails
Description:
Polar Rails is a Christmas-themed game that uses the gameplay from Empire Builder with players creating rail networks that are centered on the North Pole.

Use your initial investment to build track, then pick up commodities where they are grown, mined, or manufactured and deliver them to a lucrative place of demand. Complete a delivery and make the money you need to buy larger, faster trains and expand your railroad empire. Win the game by building the most effective railroad empire!

In more detail, players use washable crayons to draw their train routes over a map of the North Pole, including North America, Greenland, Asia, and Europe. Players start with an initial sum of money which they use to build short lengths of track during their first couple of turns. For the rest of the game, players operate their trains over the track network drawn on the board to pick up and deliver loads to various cities, then have the opportunity to add to their track network or improve their train. The game uses demand cards which list three demands, each of a commodity to be delivered to a specified city for a given payoff. Each player has three demand cards to provide opportunities for income.

Each turn consists of an operations phase and a building phase. During the operations phase, trains are moved to cities where commodities are picked up at no cost and moved to one of the cities on that player's demand cards. When the commodity is delivered, the player receives the payoff and trades that demand card for a new one. Event cards are mixed in the deck with the demand cards. When an event card is drawn the instructions are followed. During the building phase, a player may pay to build more track or upgrade their train.

A player wins by being the first to connect their track network to six of the seven major cities on the board and acquire $250,000,000 in cash on hand.

Name: Racket Roll: Tennis
Description:
Become a tennis champion by being the first to empty your deck through card-matching and rolling dice! Set in the late 70s and early 80s, up to 4 competitors engage one another to win. Includes archrivals Bjorn vs. John and Chris vs. Martina. Each is a master of a court type - grass, clay, indoor, and synthetic. Play any combination and serve yourself a winning cup with this ace!

On your turn, you either match a card with your hand with a card on the board (domino style), or roll your colored die and then place it in an empty square. The next player can match to your die, or any other die or dots printed on the minicards. The first player to place the last card of their hand wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Sport Jockeys: American Football
Description:
Play the visceral, moment-to-moment game of American Football as a card game! Captures the essence of what it’s like to play Gridiron, without statistics, players, etc. You are the team and make the calls every play as you battle it out with the opposing team. Choose to be the home team or the visitor and it’s game on! Includes 56 cards depicting offensive and defensive actions (Run, Pass, Kick, Fake, Dive, Hail Mary, Hand-Off, Kickoff, Tackle, Fumble, etc.), 1 Offense card, 2 Score cards, 1 Reference card, and 3 Indicator cubes.

After the kickoff, the player assuming the role of offense will place a "Snap" card. The opponent can then place a card that counters or follows the snap card, such as "Tackle." Offense can counter with a "Pass." Cards can be played as combinations to increase your side's points. The goal is to get more points than your opponent every play to advance your marker on the score card. After 4 plays, offense will either score points (simulating a field goal all the way to a touchdown with a 2-point conversion) or defense will score 2 points for a safety. Play continues with the opponent assuming the role of offense.

All of this can be interrupted or changed if an opponent intercepts the ball, recovers a fumble, etc. And every action played has counters. Winning players have a little luck but play their cards strategically to maximize when to play combos, which cards to play vs. keep, and how to predict their opponent's plays. To add further depth, each card has an Offense and a Defense side to it, providing for many more play possibilities.

The deck represents either a full game, a half, or a quarter of a game. Once a full game is complete, whoever has the most points wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Catan: First Adventure
Description:
The kids on Catan are adventurous, learning to sail at a young age and wanting to spend their time sailing around the small offshore islands and playing exciting games. Today, you are playing pirates and want to build camps and a fort faster than anyone else.

In Catan: First Adventure, you start with a pirate camp that sits across two of the islands in the larger ring of islands. Each island depicts a resource, and you start with one of each of the resources showing on the islands under your camp.

On a turn, you first roll the six-sided die. On a result of 1-5, all players take a resource from the reserve if they have a camp on an island with a matching number; on a result of 6, you move the Ghost Captain to an island of your choice, taking two of the resource depicted there. No one else can claim resources from this island as long as the Ghost Captain remains there.

You then move the single ship on its course clockwise around the island. If you have one of each resource — molasses, wood, goat, cutlass — you can build a camp on an empty space adjacent to the ship. If you don't have what you need, you can trade any two resources for one of your choice, or you can spend a wood and a goat for random help from Coco the parrot. You don't know what Coco might give you, but ideally it's better than the wood and goat you just sacrificed to him!

After you build all your camps, you can build a fort on an empty space by spending two of each resource, and whoever does so first wins.
Families: Series: Free PnP during 2019-2020 COVID-19 Pandemic (Asmodee)

Name: Voi, Bravi ed Infelici: Tolentino 1815
Description:
"Voi, Bravi ed Infelici: Tolentino 1815" is a wargame about the Napoleonic battle of Tolentino in 1815, the decisive episode of the Austro-Neapolitan war fought by the King of Naples, Gioacchino Murat, against the Austrians led by General Federico Bianchi. This battle saw the definitive Austrian victory, with the consequent return of the Bourbons to the Neapolitan throne and is considered by some historians as the first battle of the Italian Risorgimento.

Published in italian board-wargaming magazine "ParaBellum", issue VIII.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Escape the Dark Sector: The Collector's Box
Description:
An expansion in its own right, the Collector’s Box contains a wealth of new game content for Escape the Dark Sector while also providing stylish and practical storage for your entire collection.

With it’s sturdy, matte black box and minimal spot UV detailing, the imposing exterior of the Collector’s Box hides an elegant organizer within. Now you can store every item in your Escape the Dark Sector collection in one box with ease.

The custom insert features slots to perfectly divide your cards by type, sleeved or unsleeved. Not only is this immensely satisfying, it also cuts down on card handling time during setup - just slide out the desired group of cards when called for (Act 1, Act 2, Act 3, Crew Members, Bosses etc) and your game can be set up and packed away in moments.

The larger cavities are moulded to securely hold all your playmats, rulebooks, scorepads, pencils, dice etc - and as you can see the full set of 4 crew playmats combine to create a pleasing image of the station.

Contains:


     4 New Bosses: An array of powerful new foes, each unique and devious
     3 New Start Cards: Each offering a choice about how to begin your mission
     1 Mech Suit: A powerful, full-body contraption comprising 4 slot's worth of interlocking item cards. This awesome rig grants the wearer immense armour and firepower for a limited time, and at the expense of mobility and tactical flexibility 
     2 New Starting Weapons: Alien sidearms with variable-ammo functionality 
     4 Ammo Dice: To ensure you have enough on hand for the full arsenal the game offers 
     4 Health Trackers with Cubes: A reusable alternative to the medical record pads
     1 Dice Bag: Store all the game’s beautiful dice and tokens in one satisfying pouch
     1 “Acting Captain” Card: Used to help keep track of who is leading the crew into each chapter

Name: Tag City: Graffiti Token Promo Tile
Description: A promo graffiti token. Just add it to the other graffiti tokens. You can choose it when you set up the game.

Name: Cowboy Bebop: Space Serenade – Ein and The Blob Promo Cards
Description:
These two cards were initially distributed when the French edition of the game came out.

Ein (action card): Cannot be removed from the Purchasing Area. Effect : Draw a card. Ein activates all Team Effects.

The Blob (criminal card): The active player's turn ends. Players return to Bebop and take 2 damages. As long as this card is in play, players cannot purchase cards nor move. Each player takes a turn. The player with the most Strength and Clues accumulated makes the capture. In case of a tie, all players take 1 damage and start over.

Name: 1920: Nest of Eagles
Description:
1920 is a two-player, intermediate complexity, strategic-level wargame simulation of the  "Polish-Soviet War" the Soviet attempt to conquer Poland. Soviet and Polish forces engulf each other in swift campaigns, fighting on a large area stretching from Kiev and Smolensk in the East to Warsaw and Thorn in the West. Will the Red Army prevail and bring happiness and peace to the German and French working classes or will the Poles pull off a magnificent victory one can only describe as a 'miracle'? It only needs two players to find out an answer to this question in this exciting 2 hour wargame.

Players can learn the game via four short scenarios, being gradually introduced to the game mechanics and quickly able to grasp the accurate concept of lines of control, surprising rail transfers, and morale advantages and understand the strategic ramifications of the theater of war. Further rules cover army morale advantages, revolutionary mobilization organized by the hated Soviet political police the Cheka, the torn loyalties of the Ukrainians, fighting on both sides of the front and the formation of the Polish Volunteer Army.

A plethora of formations and units appear in the game: the Latvian Rifles, the dreaded Budyenny's Horse Army, counter-revolutionary Russian, Belorussian and Cossack troops, various Polish formations including the Siberian Brigade, support units such as tanks, flotillas, armored cars and above all armored trains, which were extensively used in the campaign.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Risky Chicken
Description:
In Risky Chicken, each player is a chicken who wants to get rich. The winning player is the first to obtain a certain number of Gold Coins.

Players take turns being the Leader of climbs up the Golden Mountain, each turn choosing a Sidekick to join them on this journey. As players ascend the Golden Mountain, they land on levels with increasing amounts of Gold Coins, but they also grow likelier to “fall off” the mountain.

At every level, the Leader and Sidekick must each decide whether to Climb (continue to press their luck) or Chicken Out (cash out and end the turn.) Both players often agree that Chickening Out is a wise decision, and they may agree to play their Chicken Out cards. However, each player can benefit by breaking their promise and playing Climb, at the expense of the other. This dynamic is inspired by the “Repeated Prisoner’s Dilemma” model of game theory. Players must weigh their greed in the short term against the value of their alliances.

Each player also receives one Chicken Trick card which gives them a special rule-bending ability (variable player power). There are 12 Chicken Trick cards, each representing a unique, silly chicken character.

-description from the publisher

Name: Nemo's War (Second Edition): Journey's End Expansion
Description:
The final expansion for Nemo's War (Second Edition), including new finale cards, a new character, additional motives and adventures, and an official 2-player variant.

A COMPREHENSIVE OPERATIONS MANUAL & BETWEEN VOYAGES GUIDE: The new Operations Manual shows how to run the ship turn-by-turn and includes many useful appendices at the end, while the new Between Voyages Guide features instruction for setup, ending the game, scoring, epilogues, variants, and more!

A NEW 2-PLAYER VERSUS VARIANT: Joining the riveting solo and cooperative modes where players command the Nautilus, in this game variant one player will play as the Imperialists, bent on its defeat. Includes special cards and 2 Imperial Squadron Miniatures!

A NEW CHARACTER TILE: Entering our story is Nemo’s son, Nadeen Dakkar, who crosses paths with his father after hearing news of mysterious events at sea!

NEW FINALE CARDS: Spice up your endings with The Trap, Imperialists’ Catspaw, Scientific Espionage, and The Kraken!

NEW STERN MOTIVES, ADDITIONAL NAUTILUS UPGRADES, AND EVEN MORE TOKENS & MARKERS!

Name: Raiders of Scythia: Huntress & Stableman
Description:
4 Promo Cards for Raiders of Scythia

2 x Huntress
Ability 1 = Gain 1 Strength per unique Eagle you own
Ability 2 = Lose 1 Gold to gain 1 Wagon and 1 Equipment

2 x Stableman
Ability 1 = Gain 1 Strength per unique Horse you own
Ability 2 = Use an opposing Hero's ability

Name: Dice Party
Description:
The night is still young and the Party community starts off to find the best Party in town. For now the streets are full of people but soon the vibe will rise on the dance floors. Who is the host making the most money out of his guests? Who throws the coolest Party? And which Party will end in a brawl?

Dice Party is a dice game for 2-4 players in which every player acts as a party host, throwing a party that competes with the parties of the other players. Each player has up to 60 dice to throw, representing party guests of three types: cool Party People (yellow), high society VIPs (orange) and experience-driven rowdys, referred to as Mob (red).

While each round is a tactical challenge, since you have three different win conditions to outreach your opponents, the game unfolds its strategic depth with its Party Animal mode. Playing this full mode you're playing multiple rounds, trying to achieve complete victory by winning once with each of the 3 victory conditions:

     All other Partys escalate due to their Mob guests.
     A VIP millionaire hits your Party.
     You pickpocket six wallets from your Party People.

Name: 花嫁が多すぎる(Too Many Brides)
Description:
Based on the Quintessential Quintuplets manga: Players vie to influence which of the quintuplets will marry Futaro Uesugi.

In each round, players are dealt 5 cards. They play one card at a time until everyone has only 2 cards left.

On your turn, you can either discard a card to change the order of the candidates, or "whisper": play a card to cause a trait to be undesirable. Immediately after a whisper, there is a simultaneous vote. Anyone who wants to challenge the whisper discards a card to do so.

At the end of the round, players score their highest-ranked candidate card that isn't cancelled by a previously unchallenged whisper.

The game ends after a set number of rounds:

3 player - 6 rounds
4 player - 4 rounds
5 player - 5 rounds.

Then the player with the most points is the winner.

Name: Trek 12: Base Camp 2
Description:
Expansion for Trek 12.

Open routes to 3 new summits: 

     50 sheets for Pokhara summit,
     50 sheets for Dhye summit,
     50 sheets for Machapuchare summit.

Name: Waste Knights: Witness Me! Promo Card
Description:
One Luck card to add to the game, distributed during Essen Spiel 2015.

After combat, if you defeat your opponent in combat, you additional game +1 reputation. If you end this combat with 2 or 1 health, you additionally gain +1 reputation.

Name: EvenQuads: Deck 1 of 4
Description:
Play any of five new mathematical games with this double-sided deck that commemorates the 50th anniversary of the Association for Women in Mathematics! EvenQuads games use symbols representing four major mathematical organizations and EvenBetter games use the flip sides featuring amazing women mathematicians.

All five games are mathematical.  EvenQuads games challenge your  matching speed as you collect Quads, as solitaire, with friends or in a  rummy version.  EvenBetter games help you learn about the featured  women. All five games are specially designed to accommodate our unique double-sided cards.

Deck 1 (of 4) of EvenQuads includes 64 cards, and an insert with instructions in both English y Español, and a description of the EvenQuads mathematics.

Name: Sick Minds
Description:
A game of folds with a strong thematic: criminology.

The game is a highly strategic game which add new features to the game of folds:

     powers that you can buy to change the game rules.
     a kind of rock/paper/scissor mechanics to add fun to the game.
     an original scoring mode counting the number of cards at the end of the turn. 
     you play two cards once at a time during your turn, adding more strategy and depth to the game

Name: 3 Mädchen und 3 Jungen
Description:
Four big pawns represent the parents, the family dog and the house keeper, while the six small pawns represent the kids (the Brady Bunch). The goal of the game is for the adults and the dog to find the kids and take them home to score points.

If up to 4 players are playing the players represent the adults and the dog, while the kids are moved only according to the game rules. If more than 4 players are playing, the kids are also moved by players.

—user summary

Name: Pirates of the Dread Sea
Description:
Pirates of the Dread Sea is a fast paced, fun tabletop skirmish game for two or more players. In Pirates of the Dread Sea you create a crew of pirates from various fantasy races (or just use the pre-designed crews) such as Orcs, Dwarves, the Undead or Humans and fight for treasure and survival. Although PODS can be enjoyed as a single game, and can easily be taught to new players for an evenings entertainment, it can also support long campaigns, during which players can personalise and upgrade their crews.

Games of PODS are based on a Scenario. Scenario’s usually involve finding treasure, though sometimes they may involve capturing or rescuing hostages, or simply fighting. Each player controls a small Crew of miniatures (around half a dozen) and players take it in turns to act with one miniature at a time. During a miniatures “phase” they can perform two Actions (Captain’s can perform three) such as moving, shooting and fighting hand to hand.

In addition to a huge variety of weapons, skills and traits which can be applied to characters dependent on their race and experience, Event Cards add another level of tactics to the game. An Event Card can throw your opponent entirely off track, or boost your own forces, whether that be by ensuing the enemy miss a shot, or by boosting your crews morale by singing a shanty to them!

Pirates of the Dread Sea is a PIRATE war game, not just a war game with a pirate theme tacked on. Everything about the game has been designed to fit the setting, and create fun, narrative, exciting adventures on your tabletop.

—description from the publisher

Name: L'osti d'jeu des humoristes
Description:
In this party game for adults, TEN luminaries of humor take you into their comedic world with around thirty cards each, written in their beautiful, gentle and perfect hands. 
So you have 300 new, really funny and salty cards that you can play on your own or add to your big game collection.

The game play remains the same:

     La Grande Yeule reads a black card. 
     All other players choose a red card from their hand that would fill the |… |. 
     La Grande Yeule then chooses her/his favorite red card and the player who placed it wins the black card.


Also, as a bonus, this game contains the L'osti d'jeu: FranÃ§ois PÃ©russe.

—description (translated) from the publisher

Name: The Drowned and the Damned
Description:
Set in the same universe as the skirmish game Pirates of the Dread Sea, this game pits squadrons of warships belonging to different fantasy races against one another.

There's a dedicated line of 1:600 models, initially dwarves and elves, with more to come.

Name: Light Gray & the Abundant Tactics of the Fifth Era
Description:
LG TACTICS is a strategy-lite battle card game where you must outmaneuver your opponents to win. It features simple gameplay where you decide which cards to deploy and attack with.

The game is played with a single deck of cards and you can learn the rules in minutes. Players need to Recruit, Deploy and Attack with their cards until only one army remains. You can play against one or more opponent, or even play solo to test your skills. Games take about 15 minutes per person, and 1 - 5 people can play (more if you combine 2 decks).

Game cards feature a single number representing its power level. Some powerful cards have a deploy requirement in order to play onto the battlefield.

TACTICS comes with 72 cards and rule book in a game box. Cards feature original illustrations in a minimal fantasy silhouette style.

—description from the publisher

Name: Vindication: Wintertide Promo Pack
Description:
"Contains 15 bone-chilling cards for Vindication Board Game to warm your frozen heart.  That's cold.  We know."

15 all-new promotional cards not included in any version of Vindication. Includes an all-new “Equippable Relic” card, which attaches to a companion.

Cards include:
    3 Companion Cards
    1 Lost Pet Spirit Card
    1 Cursed Pet Spirit Card
    3 Trait Cards
    1 Relic Card + 1 Equippable Relic Card
    4 Monster Cards
    1 Loot Card
    Excess Shivery Vibes

Name: Na Babią Górę
Description: In the game, players will climb the Babia Góra, observing nature. Taking cards from the common pot allows you to build another level of the mountain and the pawn shows the place of our climbing. The card can be used in three ways: as a part of the mountain, as an element of nature or as an equipment. In order to enter the next cards it is necessary to have the appropriate equipment. Players earn points for the cards they have visited and sets of nature cards (animals, plants). The player with the most points wins.

Name: Beisbol Montecarlo
Description:
There are two teams, with 10 tokens each: a pitcher, a catcher, a hitter and 7 generic.

Before start a game, the cards are mixed and a half goes to the big pairs space and the other half to the small pairs space, with the text face down.

Each player take and rolls a dice; the bigger number goes to pitch and the lower to the bat. The tokens are placed accordingly in the field. The player with the hitter then rolls both dices, the resulting number indicates the play: a strike, a ball, foul or steal the base. The base also can be stolen between plays. When the dices shows a pair, it's time to take a card and follow their instructions.

—user summary

Name: Whac-a-Mole Stack-a-mole
Description:
Inspired by the kid favorite Whac-A-Mole game, Stack-A-Mole is the fun way to teach little ones about colors, matching and sequencing. Your mission is to use your mallet to stack up the mole cups in a certain sequence. But hurry- your opponent is trying to stack them first. Be the first to stack all the cups in the correct order and you win! It's mallet-smacking, mole-stackin' and learning fun!

—description from the publisher

Name: Furl
Description:
Either furl up a row of your discs, or unfurl a stack. If you have a disc in your end row at the start of your turn, you win.

COMPONENTS:

     Hexagonal board with 4 hexes per side
     15 white discs
     15 black discs


RULES OVERVIEW (Please refer to rulebook)

Players alternate turns until the victory condition is reached.

Each turn, choose one of two types of moves:

Furl

Choose two or more of your discs in an unbroken line, and stack them on the disc at the end of that line.

Unfurl

Choose a stack of at least two discs and sow them one per space in a straight line starting in the space in front of your stack. Intermediate spaces must be empty, but the final space may be occupied by an enemy disc or enemy stack. If so, you capture those discs.

GOAL

You win if, at the start of your turn, you have a disc or stack on the row farthest from your starting position.

You lose if you have no legal moves.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hippos & Crocodiles: Marabou
Description:
Marabou Stork is an expansion of Hippos & Crocodiles that contains 12 bird pieces.

You can use this animal to play games from 2 to 4 players. For 4 players I recommend playing in pairs with the members of each pair facing each other, so the turns alternate between pairs:

Team A: Anna
Team B: Bob
Team A: Carl
Team B; Diana
… and so on.

The couple that places the last animal wins.

The Marabou Stork has an exception to placement: Once per game, the player can place one and only one of her tiles with the beak or feet outside the board.

Name: De S.P.E.L.Show: Het bordspel
Description:
Play the wildly popular S.P.E.L.show at home now!
Challenge your friends or family to a strategic language battle and show how good your knowledge of the Dutch language is. For example, what is a "barki"? What is the past tense of "gliding"? And which word means both an "end" and a "castle"?
The two players with the most points after five rounds advance to the final round. Are you the best player in the final? Then you win the game!

—description from the designer

Name: Neighborhood Conflict
Description:
Neighborhood Conflict is based on the creator's childhood where the local kids formed their own governments and economies. Construction, share trading, real estate, currency manipulation, diplomacy, theft and combat are all optional strategic tools for getting ahead in Neighborhood Conflict.

Players play as a kid and interact with other kids that have different social and economic skills, and try to manipulate them into assisting their own ascension to the top. Kids use "actions" to either attempt to socially alter the opinions and behavior of other kids or to manage and improve their own financial situation. The goal of the game is to acquire as much wealth as possible before time is up.

—description from the designer

Neighborhood Conflict was modeled after the LARP MicroCiv.

NOTE:

     Not to be confused with first edition of Tactical Friction, which was also named Neighborhood Conflict, but got renamed to Tactical Friction in 2008.
     Not to be confused with first edition of Micronations, which was also named Neighborhood Conflict in years 2011–2013.

Name: Aristeia!: Prime Time
Description:
Prime Time is a new Aristeia! expansion that allows up to 4 players to play in the HexaDome. The fun is multiplied, while the rules and some game elements have been adapted to keep the same rhythm, feeling, and match duration of Aristeia!. The booklet includes 4 new scenarios that are exclusive to this multiplayer mode, some of which will eventually be adapted to the standard game mode.

Being an experienced player is not necessary at all. Prime Time’s booklet includes an introduction which will allow rookie players to easily learn the ropes of Aristeia!, step by step, with the appropriate modifications added for 3 or 4 players. Two specific short-duration scenarios are also added to help players learn the basic concepts and mechanics of Aristeia!. Veteran players will find a section with all of Prime Time’s new rules, so they will not need to go through the tutorial.

—description from the publisher

Name: Locked Adventures: Der Fall – Berlin
Description: Your team accepted the invitation of a renowned journalism school to Berlin, where a student turned to you for help: Her friend Christopher suddenly went into hiding because he had got wind of a suspicious matter. Christopher was in the utmost panic and said that it was a matter of life and death, but the police must not be called on under any circumstances! Your investigative talent is more in demand than ever in the new city. You make your way through unknown Berlin to help Christopher. Are you late or can you still provide last-minute help?

Name: Citytrip Paris
Description:
Citytrip Paris is the third game in the 'Citytrip series' featuring new gameplay elements.

As a tour guide you want to create the most memorable trip by visiting famous buildings and musea, events, restaurants and more.

Citytrip Paris is a flip & write game that is quick to setup and easy to play. With a basic and advanced scoresheet, 23 starting points and 44 different missions, no 2 games will feel the same!

One player flips the upper card of the action stack. Simultaneously everybody chooses 2 actions that are horizontally or vertically adjacent (=7 possible combinations). Each player creates a road and circles achieved goals which give points on the scoresheet. The game ends when the action stack is empty. The player with the highest satisfaction score wins Citytrip Paris.

—description from the designer

Name: Finger Guns at High Noon: Lasso Promo Cards
Description:
A set of three cards to add to the base game:

     KEEPER Promo - Pauleen "Powderkeg" Guthrie
     KEEPER Promo - Sampson "Second Life" Stinton
     INSTANT Promo - The Scuggins Gang

Name: Claim: Minotaurs
Description:
Alternate faction for Claim or Claim 2.

If you lead with a Minotaur and win the hand, the other player may take the card they played back into their hand.

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – The Whisperers Faction Set
Description:
This faction starter contains the cards and rules you need to bring the dangerous Whisperers group and their gruesome minions to the tabletop and your games of Call to Arms. In addition, bonus cards are provided for the All Out War miniatures game.

Miniatures:

     1 Resin Alpha
     1x Resin Beta
     1x Resin Lydia
     3x Resin Whisperers Minions


All Out War Cards:

     Rusty Old Sawed-Off Equipment Card
     Bow Equipment Card
     Hunting Knife Equipment Card
     Hunting Knife Equipment Card
     Machete Equipment Card
     Two-by-four Equipment Card
     Alpha Survivor Card
     Beta Survivor Card
     Lydia Survivor Card
     Whisperer 1 Survivor Card
     Whisperer 2 Survivor Card
     Whisperer 3 Survivor Card
     Reference Card


Call to Arm Cards:

     Whisperer Bow Equipment Card
     Flaming Arrow Equipment Card
     Head Spikes Equipment Card
     Alpha Survivor Card
     Beta Survivor Card
     Lydia Survivor Card
     Whisperer 1 Survivor Card
     Whisperer 2 Survivor Card
     Whisperer 3 Survivor Card
     Reference Card
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: Claim: Mermaids
Description:
Alternate faction that can be added to Claim or Claim 2.

When you collect Mermaids into your Score Pile, leave them face up. For every Mermaid you have, your played cards have a -1 value.

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – The Whisperers Booster
Description:
These gruesome minions will swell the ranks of your Whisperers, striking fear into the hearts of your opponents in your games of Call to Arms. In addition, bonus cards are provided for the All Out War miniatures game.

Miniatures:

     3x Resin Whisperers Minions


All Out War Cards:

     Bow Equipment Card
     Flaming Arrow Equipment Card
     Sickle Equipment Card
     Hay Hook Equipment Card
     Whisperer 1 Survivor Card
     Whisperer 2 Survivor Card
     Whisperer 3 Survivor Card


Call to Arms Cards:

     Whisperer Bow Equipment Card
     Flaming Arrow Equipment Card
     Head Spikes Equipment Card
     Whisperer 1 Survivor Card
     Whisperer 2 Survivor Card
     Whisperer 3 Survivor Card
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: Cheeseboard Deluxe
Description:
There’s no appetizer so mouth-watering as a good cheeseboard. There’s a pleasure to timeless foods—meat, cheeses, fruits and grains—spread out like a savory work of art. These morsels combine in endless ways—do you want cheese and crackers? Crackers and meat? Cheese and fruit? Do you want to stack one of everything into a giant charcuterie sandwich?

But the real question is: can you make a good cheeseboard? The party is barely an hour from now! You have the ingredients, but they still need to be cut and served. It’s time to find out if you’ve got the chops to make a cheeseboard deluxe.

Cheeseboard Deluxe is a solitaire roll-and-write for one player, originally developed for the 2020 Solitaire Print-and-Play Contest. Your goal is to build a jam-packed cheeseboard, leaving as few empty spaces as possible at the end of the game.

Each round, you draw shapes representing food onto each of your cutting boards. When you can’t draw another shape onto a cutting board, that board is done, and when every board is done, the number of empty spaces remaining becomes your score. The more spaces you manage to fill in, the lower your score—and the better!

—description from the designer

Name: Śląscy Potentaci
Description: Card and resource management game about industrialization in XIXth century Upper Silesia. You are taking the role of one of the major Silesian aristocratic houses ( Ballestrem, Giesche, Henckel von Donnesmarck, Hochberg, Schaffgotsch). In-game you have to make 2 actions out of five: Influence, extraction, research, building,exchange. Influence is needed to build more advanced buildings. Research gives cards from the technology deck. These cards are advancement cards or event cards. In the game, you are collecting resources by drawing cards from the extraction deck. You are also expanding your house by raising buildings in different fields. These buildings are giving bonuses to area resources. They are also giving victory points needed to win the game. Exchange lets you trade resources with bank in proportions 1:3 (or 1:2 with the special building). The game ends when any player earns 27 victory points. There are optional variants: with constructing every building, or a faster variant with 21 victory points needed to end the game.

Name: Happy Little Dinosaurs: 5–6 Player Expansion Pack
Description: This pack expands Happy Little Dinosaurs to six players by adding  two dinosaur player boards and the corresponding meeples, as well as fifty cards.

Name: Death Ride Normandy: Point du Hoc
Description:
Death Ride Normandy series covers the entire Normandy campaign from 6 June 1944 up to Cobra.  It will be as grand a game as Death Ride Kursk and have all the richness of that game series.  This series will be broken down into many smaller games. The Base Game focuses on the operation at Point* du Hoc conducted by elements of the 2nd Ranger Battalion.

Component Lists:

        Pt du Hoc Map
        1x Counter Sheet
        1x Scenario Card
        DRN Common Charts and Tables (Losses, Air, DRMs, Firepower, Game Turn Track, Battle Board, Examples, Terrain, Shore Fire, Air/Naval Bombardment, Call for Fire, Fire and Assault Tables, Paradrop Tables, C2, and Logistics Tables...) bound into a spiral book
      29ID Order of Battle
      352ID Order of Battle


—description from the publisher

* should be spelled "Pointe", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pointe_du_Hoc

Name: Crowded Cave Adventures
Description:
Crowded Cave Adventures is a Dungeon Crawler, Roguelike RPG Card Game within layers of narrative chapters. You manage your heroes, filling up their backpack with artifacts, fairies and scrolls, completing quests and defeating pixel art monsters and bosses.

It's an open world board game in which you'll be exploring up to 15 "Cave Worlds", all connected together. There are more than 1700 cards to discover and an infinity amount of power combinations depending on the hero's class, Guild and the rarity of the legendary treasures found inside the Caves...

Up to 4 players can either team up or compete in order to be the richest, the most powerful adventurer or the one who discovers the true nature of this amazing universe. When the main boss is defeated, the Run ends!

Draw a card, interact with it, explore more, fight monsters and stay wise in order to save your hero's life. Should'nt you come back to your camp now before it's too late?

—description from the designer

Name: King of Potato
Description:
King of Potato is a cardgame where the king is missing and players will take turns to get him.  At the end of their turn, the player will get a victory coin for having the King. You will need three victory coins to win.
